statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -2 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 10 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -17 \\ -4 \\ 11 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -2 \\ 2 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 2 \\ -2 \\ -5 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 10 \\ 4 \\ -4 \\ 2 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -17 \\ -4 \\ 11 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -4 \\ 4 \\ 3 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
